content: Description:Today one of my friends told me someone invited her in person to join and invest on some platform and asked me to have a review. So, I decided to share it with you.- They ask their investors to lock their money for 720 days and in return and give unreal profits even more than 100 percent which is not legit according to (https://www.stakingrewards.com/staking/)- They offer an 8 percent referral commission which is too good to be true.- They changed the domain address many times, last time they changed from icbtoker.com to Icbroker.io- According to this link (https://www.fca.org.uk/news/warnings/international-chamber-broker) they provided fake documents to their clients.Using a cheap 'dashlite' panel can be another sign. Reference Link:Icbroker.ioDetected domains:icbroker.vip - Active (redirects to Icbroker.io)icbtoker.com - InactiveQuote from: SFR10 on August 01, 2022, 03:00:12 PMIt seems they've hit the jackpot by choosing a registrar that doesn't "really" care about reports [unfortunately, it complements their operations perfectly]!Here are a bunch of other active domains with redirections to the ".io extension":- All of them are using NameCheap services!icbroker.net [redirection proof]icbroker.org [redirection proof]icbroker.info [redirection proof]icbroker.us [redirection proof]icbroker.biz [redirection proof]icbroker.club [redirection proof]icbroker.co.uk [redirection proof]icbroker.live [redirection proof]Other back-ups:- The first two are using Joker services!icbcrypto.services [archived]icb.finance [archived]icbchain.net [archived]WhoIs info:https://whois.domaintools.com/icbroker.ioCreated on 2022-01-11Expires on 2027-01-11Updated on 2022-03-24Payment Method:Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc...Archive:https://archive.ph/VgKD7Additional Notes:In order to take down this project please report the website to their registrar (In this case NameCheap). Here is a little guide about how to report the scammers to their registrar: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5281378Scamadviser:https://www.scamadviser.com/check-website/icbroker.io

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Leviathan.007 on July 31, 2022, 08:14:50 PMToday one of my friends told me someone invited her in person to join and invest on some platform... Honestly, this should be enough to consider that someone a scammer. That's what I would do. If you are asked to invest in something from people you don't know (or even from people you do know) and they are offering you an unreasonably good deal, most of the time it's a scam waiting to happen. Why would they contact your friend? What's so special about him/her?How did they even find your friend in the first place?If the platform is so good, people would stand in line throwing at them their investments, and they wouldn't need to go around and ask people for money.
